title: 103_hr2676
content: The "SSI Reform Act of 1993" increases income and resource eligibility standards and benefits while eliminating certain resource exclusions. The "SSI Reform Act of 1993" raises income and resource eligibility standards under the Social Security Act, adjusting poverty lines and percentages while updating the year references. The SSI Reform Act of 1993 increased income and resource eligibility standards under the Social Security Act, adjusting poverty lines and percentages while updating year references. The SSI Reform Act of 1993 updated income and resource eligibility standards by adjusting poverty lines and percentages, changing year references to 1994 and 1995. The SSI Reform Act of 1993 updated income and resource eligibility standards by adjusting poverty lines and percentages for the years 1994 to 1998 and beyond. The term 'poverty line' refers to the official poverty line defined by the Office of Management and Budget. The amendments made by this subsection do not reduce benefits for individuals or couples receiving supplemental security income under title XVI of the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to reduce benefits by eliminating certain resource exclusions under Section 1613. Subsection (d) is also struck from the Act. SEC. 3 amends Section 1612(a)(2) of the Social Security Act to disregard in-kind support and maintenance when determining income. SEC. 4 introduces a work incentive. SEC. 4 amends the Social Security Act to increase the work incentive by raising the amount from $780 to $2,400 and changing the percentage from one-half to \2/3\. The Social Security Act is amended to change the retirement age to 64 for calendar year 1994 and to 63 for calendar year 1995. The amendments take effect on January 1, 1994. The Social Security Act is amended to change the retirement age to 63 for calendar year 1995. The amendments take effect on January 1, 1995. The Social Security Act is amended to change the retirement age to 62 for calendar year 1996. The amendments take effect on January 1, 1996.
